title: Why did I get chat restricted?
body:
1 game, was at honor level 2, level 2. Now I'm honor level 1 because people in my game said "better jg wins" and I can't let that slide. Please tell me how I could have handled this situation differently. Yes, I'll get downvotes, but I'm trying to improve. I made this account to not get banned, vowing to never be toxic. What part of this chat is toxic? I get it looks bad, but the people talking to me are 0/14 and flaming me, acting like it's my fault. I genuinely don't understand why I'm supposed to be the punching bag, sitting there muting them so I won't rage. I appreciate all feedback.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=March 15 2019,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Icj8Epfx,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-06-25T00:42:59.312+0000)
>
> I can't let that slide

That is why you are chat restricted. When you gain the ability to restrain yourself from flaming your team at the slightest perceived offense, you'll be much less likely to break the rules and receive a punishment.

> [{quoted}](name=March 15 2019,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Icj8Epfx,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-06-25T00:42:59.312+0000)
>
> Please tell me how I could have handled this situation differently.

Let things slide, at least until the post-game lobby where you send in a report. Responding to misbehavior in chat with some misbehavior of your own does no good.

> [{quoted}](name=March 15 2019,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Icj8Epfx,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-06-25T00:42:59.312+0000)
>
> What part of this chat is toxic?

You argued most of the time, promised to mute people but apparently didn't and kept arguing instead, insulted teammates' intelligence, harassed teammates for their scores, called for reports (one report does as much as nine; calling for reports is just harassment), announced intent to report (useless harassment).

> [{quoted}](name=March 15 2019,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Icj8Epfx,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-06-25T00:42:59.312+0000)
>
> the people talking to me are 0/14 and flaming me

That doesn't impact your punishment, which is based on what you choose to do. If someone's chat messages are bothering you, mute them. If someone's chat messages broke the rules, report them.

> [{quoted}](name=March 15 2019,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=Icj8Epfx,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-06-25T00:42:59.312+0000)
>
> be the punching bag, sitting there muting them

How in the world can you be a punching bag after muting them? You literally won't even be able to tell whether they're doing any "punching."

Practical advice: every time you feel like ignoring the rules and doing whatever you want, imagine how silly you'd feel when you not only get a punishment for it but also display to a bunch of strangers how you broke rules that you were fully aware of and reaped the reward. That's how I avoid traffic tickets, by the way.
Flaming/blaming, and harassing others and calling for reports.
Thanks for the response. I should not call for reports when people are being toxic? I didn't know that was a rule.

When you are calling for reports repeatedly in addition to your flaming, it is a form of harassment, which is against the rules.

Further, there’s literally no benefit to having multiple people report, so there’s no reason for you to ask other people to report.

The purpose of you calling for reports is to get someone punished. No one wants their account punished, thus the way you ask for reports is considered a harassment. 

There is no need to ask for reports, all a report does is to flag the system to review the game, and the toxicity  number the system returns will be the same regardless of how many reports one recieves. Meaning; more reports doesn't get anyone punished likier or faster.

Asking for reports at best annoys the other player, at worse can get you punished.

Before you ask, the typically system doesn't punish based on one game alone, it punishes based on consistency x severity.  Meaning a player can be punished for 1 game of extreme toxicity or many games of mild toxicity.

Bolded attitude is the issue on how to handle things differently.

Stop reading the chat and just play your game.

Riot has made it so anything that can be construed negatively(which is basically everything) is toxic...so just don't chat.

I'm against toxicity, but I've seen way worse than that, though.

However, you have to understand that unfortunately Riot doesn't care at all about the context of your flaming. So, I know it sucks, I hate it too, but just mute people. You're not "letting that slide", you're shutting them up. Maybe drop a little something like "I don't want to hear an idiot just like you. Muted.". It might make you feel better because you got back at them, and I reaaaalllly doubt you'll get banned for that.
